New Records: Mohammed Haris scored 28 runs in 11 balls, a record for a debutant in a T20 World Cup match.
Shadab Khan became the fastest Pakistan player to score 50 runs in a T20 World Cup game with a 22-ball 52.
Key Match Events: Mohammed Haris' dismissal brought Pakistan back into the game after an initial struggle.
Shadab Khan bowled a crucial over, removing key South African batsmen to shift momentum.
Rain delay led to a revised target and Pakistan's successful chase.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain Babar Azam expressed confidence in the team's ability to qualify for the semi-finals despite previous losses.
The match was crucial for both teams' tournament progression.
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam praised Mohammed Haris and the lower-order batsmen for their contributions.
South Africa captain Bavuma criticized his team's batting and fielding performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Pakistan's second consecutive win, reigniting their World Cup hopes.
Mohammed Wasim and Naseem Shah's death bowling was instrumental in limiting South Africa's chase.
